prtlabel.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /*****************************************************************************
00002                                                                            
00003   PrintLabel:  Prints a PDS label in the Object Description Language
00004                to a terminal device.
00005 
00006   Input:
00007          base_node    - Pointer to aggregate node of the ODL tree with which
00008                         printing is to begin.  This node, and all aggregates
00009                         beneath it will be printed.
00010 
00011   Output:  There are no output parameters and no function value is returned.
00012            The label is written to the terminal using output routine
00013            ODLPrintStmt.  The default version of this output routine writes
00014            to the 'stdout' file, but developers can substitute their own
00015            versions of ODLPrintStmt to support workstations and such. 
00016 
00017   Author:  Randy Davis, University of Colorado LASP
00018 
00019   Creation Date: 11 October 1990
00020   Last Modified: 18 May 1991
00021 
00022   History:
00023 
00024   Creation - This routine was introduced in Version 2.0 of the ODLC library.
00025   a) In Version 1 of the ODLC software, the routine WriteLabel could be
00026      called (and still can be called) to print to a terminal as well as
00027      a file device.  PrintLabel has been added to allow for output to
00028      workstations and such without disturbing the file writing capabilities
00029      found in WriteLabel.  PrintLabel and WriteLabel are identical except
00030      for the routine called to perform output.
00031   
00032   Version 2.1 - 13 March 1991 - Randy Davis, U. of Colorado LASP
00033   a) Now prints out comments associated with an aggregate or parameter.
00034   b) Eliminated use of the 'level' field, which has been deleted
00035      from aggregate nodes.
00036   c) Modified so that if both a name and class are specified for an
00037      object, they are printed out in the PDS standard format, ie:
00038 
00039         OBJECT = class
00040           NAME = name
00041           ... other parameters ...
00042         END_OBJECT = class
00043 
00044      If an object class is not given, then the old-style is used:
00045 
00046         OBJECT = name
00047           ... parameters ...
00048         END_OBJECT
00049 
00050      The latter style is always used for groups, since they don't have
00051      a class.
00052 
00053   Version 2.2 - 18 May 1991 - M. DeMore, Jet Propulsion Laboratory
00054     Removed include statements that were Unix specific and placed them
00055     in odldef.h. Removed function prototypes of ODL routines and added
00056     include file odlinter.h.
00057 
00058   Version 2.3 - 13 October 1991 - M. DeMore, Jet Propulsion Laboratory
00059     Modified to handle new argument list to ODLFormatString, in order
00060     to handle backslashes in DOS file names.  Added pds_finish_label
00061     test for toolbox use.
00062 
00063  ****************************************************************************/
00064 
00065 #include "odldef.h"
00066 #include "odlinter.h"
00067 
00068 /* The following define the maximum number of characters in a label line, the
00069    number of characters to indent on the left margin for each step up in
00070    aggregate nesting level, and the minimum spacing for a parameter name */
00071 
00072 #define  MAXLABLINE 70
00073 #define  INDENTSIZE  2
00074 #define  MINAMESIZE 20
00075 
00076 #ifdef PDS_TOOLBOX
00077 
00078 extern int pds_finish_label;
00079 
00080 #endif
00081 
00082 /* The following macro is used to space in properly from the left margin */
00083 
00084 #define indentf(X) for (i=0 ; i < X ; i++) stmt[len++] = ' '
00085 
00086 
00087 void PrintLabel (
00088 
00089      AGGREGATE   base_node)
00090 
00091 {
00092 
00093   AGGREGATE  node;              /* Pointer to current node                  */
00094   AGGREGATE  old_node;          /* Pointer to previous node                 */
00095   PARAMETER  parameter;         /* Pointer to current parameter node        */
00096   VALUE      data;              /* Pointer to current parameter value       */
00097   int        i;                 /* Loop index                               */
00098   int        ip;                /* Number of parens to print for sequence   */
00099   int        ncol;              /* Current output line column number        */
00100   int        nindent;           /* Indentation for parameter names          */
00101   int        nl;                /* Length of current parameter name         */
00102   int        nlv;               /* Length of current value                  */
00103   int        no;                /* Alignment on OBJECT/END_OBJECT lines     */
00104   int        ns;                /* Alignment for parameter assignments      */
00105   int        nv;                /* Alignment for parameter values           */
00106   int        vindent;           /* Indentation for values                   */
00107   int        col_count;         /* Count of array columns processed         */
00108   char       stmt[ODLMAXSTMT];  /* Buffer to hold each statement            */
00109   int        len;               /* Number of characters in output statement */
00110 
00111   if (base_node == NULL)
00112     {
00113       return;
00114     }
00115 
00116   /* Process the base node first and then all the nodes beneath it */
00117 
00118   old_node = base_node->parent;
00119   node = base_node;
00120   nindent = 0;
00121 
00122   while (node != NULL)
00123     {
00124      /* Put out any END_OBJECTs or END_GROUPs that are needed */
00125 
00126      if (node != base_node && node->parent == old_node)
00127        {
00128          /* The new object or group belongs to the old node.  We defer the
00129             END_OBJECT or END_GROUP for the old node until we're done
00130             processing all of its dependent nodes, so we don't do anything
00131             here except put a blank line before the OBJECT or GROUP line
00132             if we're not going to put out a comment first */
00133 
00134          if (node->comment == NULL)
00135            {
00136              ODLPrintStmt ("\n");
00137            }
00138        }
00139      else
00140        {
00141          /* The new object or group is at the same or lower level than the old
00142             object or group. Put out the END_OBJECT or END_GROUP for the
00143             old node and all of its ancestors, up to and including the node
00144             at the same level as the new node */
00145 
00146          while (node->parent != old_node)
00147            {
00148              len = 0;
00149              nindent -= INDENTSIZE;
00150              indentf (nindent);
00151              no = MINAMESIZE + INDENTSIZE;
00152 
00153              if (old_node->kind  == KA_OBJECT && 
00154                  old_node->objClass != NULL && old_node->objClass[0] != '\0')
00155                {
00156                  sprintf (&stmt[len], "%-*s = %s\n\n",
00157                           no,
00158                           "END_OBJECT",
00159                           old_node->objClass);
00160                }
00161              else
00162                {
00163                  sprintf (&stmt[len], "%-*s = %s\n\n",
00164                           no,
00165                           (old_node->kind==KA_OBJECT)?"END_OBJECT":"END_GROUP",
00166                           old_node->name);
00167                }
00168 
00169              ODLPrintStmt (stmt);
00170              old_node = ParentAggregate (old_node);
00171            }
00172        }
00173 
00174      /* Put out the comment, if any associated with the new aggregate node */
00175 
00176      if (node->comment != NULL)
00177        {
00178          ODLFormatComment (stmt, node->comment, nindent+1, MAXLABLINE);
00179          ODLPrintStmt (stmt);
00180        }
00181  
00182      /* Put in the OBJECT = name or GROUP = name line for the new node,
00183         unless this is a root node */
00184 
00185      if (node->parent != NULL)
00186        {
00187          len = 0;
00188          indentf (nindent);
00189          nindent += INDENTSIZE;
00190          no = MINAMESIZE + INDENTSIZE;
00191 
00192          if (node->kind  == KA_OBJECT && 
00193              node->objClass != NULL && node->objClass[0] != '\0')
00194            {
00195              sprintf (&stmt[len], "%-*s = %s\n",
00196               no,
00197               "OBJECT",
00198               node->objClass);
00199          len = strlen (stmt);
00200 
00201              indentf (nindent);
00202              sprintf (&stmt[len], "%-*s = %s\n",
00203                       MINAMESIZE,
00204                       "NAME",
00205                       node->name);
00206            }
00207          else
00208            {
00209              sprintf (&stmt[len], "%-*s = %s\n",
00210                       no,
00211                       (node->kind == KA_OBJECT) ? "OBJECT" : "GROUP",
00212                       node->name);
00213            }
00214 
00215          ODLPrintStmt (stmt);
00216        }
00217 
00218      /* Generate the attribute and pointer assignment statements for
00219         the current object or group */
00220 
00221      parameter = FirstParameter (node);
00222 
00223      while (parameter != NULL)
00224        {
00225          /* Print out the comment associated with the parameter, if any */
00226 
00227          if (parameter->comment != NULL)
00228            {
00229              ODLFormatComment (stmt, parameter->comment, nindent+1, MAXLABLINE);
00230              ODLPrintStmt (stmt);
00231            }
00232          
00233          len = 0;
00234 
00235          /* Determine the padding necessary to make the equal sign and
00236             values for this assignment line up nicely */
00237 
00238          ns = (parameter->node_kind==KP_POINTER) ? MINAMESIZE-1 : MINAMESIZE;
00239 
00240          /* Calculate the indentation to the start of the value for this
00241             assignment.  This amount of indentation will be applied if
00242             the value continues onto second and subsequent lines so that
00243             values will line up better */
00244 
00245          nl = strlen (parameter->name);
00246          nv = ((nl > ns)? nl : ns) + 3;
00247          vindent = nindent + nv;
00248 
00249          /* Write out the parameter name with appropriate indentation and
00250             padding */
00251 
00252          indentf (nindent);
00253 
00254          if (parameter->node_kind == KP_POINTER)
00255            {
00256              stmt[len++] = '^';
00257            }
00258 
00259          sprintf (&stmt[len], "%-*s = ",
00260                   ns,
00261                   parameter->name);
00262          len += nv;
00263 
00264          /* Perform value-kind dependent formatting */
00265 
00266          switch (parameter->value_kind)
00267            {
00268              case KV_SEQUENCE:
00269            ip = (parameter->rows > 0)? parameter->rows : 1;
00270            if (ip > 2) ip = 2;
00271            for (i=0; (i < ip); i++)
00272                  {
00273                    stmt[len++] = '(';
00274                    vindent++;
00275                  }
00276                break;
00277 
00278              case KV_SET:
00279                stmt[len++] = '{';
00280                vindent++;
00281                break;
00282 
00283              default:
00284                break;
00285            }
00286 
00287          /* Process every value for this assignment */
00288 
00289          col_count = 0;
00290          ncol = vindent;
00291 
00292          data = FirstValue (parameter);
00293 
00294          while (data != NULL)
00295            {
00296              if (data->item.type != TV_STRING)
00297                {
00298                  /* Determine the number of character spaces the new value
00299                     will occupy on the current line */
00300 
00301                  nlv = data->item.length;
00302                  if (data->item.type == TV_SYMBOL && data->item.format == 0)
00303                    {
00304                      /* This is a quoted symbolic literal: account for the
00305                         space occupied by the delimiting apostrophes */
00306 
00307                      nlv += 2;
00308                    }
00309 
00310                  ncol += nlv;
00311 
00312                  if (ncol >= MAXLABLINE)
00313                    {
00314                      /* Adding the new value would overflow the current line,
00315                         so start a new line */
00316 
00317                      stmt[len++] = '\n';
00318                      indentf (vindent);
00319                      ncol = vindent + nlv;
00320                    }
00321                }
00322 
00323              /* Format the data value, according to its data type */
00324 
00325              switch (data->item.type)
00326                {
00327                  case TV_INTEGER:
00328                    len += ODLFormatInteger (&stmt[len], &data->item);
00329                    break;
00330 
00331                  case TV_REAL:
00332                    len += ODLFormatReal (&stmt[len], &data->item);
00333                    break;
00334 
00335                  case TV_SYMBOL:
00336                    len += ODLFormatSymbol (&stmt[len], &data->item);
00337                    break;
00338 
00339                  case TV_STRING:
00340                    if (parameter->node_kind == KP_POINTER)
00341               len += ODLFormatString (&stmt[len], &data->item, &ncol,
00342                                          nindent+2*INDENTSIZE, MAXLABLINE-2, 1, 1);
00343                    else
00344               len += ODLFormatString (&stmt[len], &data->item, &ncol,
00345                                          nindent+2*INDENTSIZE, MAXLABLINE-2, 1, 0);
00346                    break;
00347 
00348                  case TV_DATE:
00349                    len += ODLFormatDate (&stmt[len], &data->item);
00350                    break;
00351 
00352                  case TV_TIME:
00353                    len += ODLFormatTime (&stmt[len], &data->item);
00354                    break;
00355 
00356                  case TV_DATE_TIME:
00357                    len += ODLFormatDateTime (&stmt[len], &data->item);
00358                    break;
00359                }
00360            
00361              /* Get the next data value for this assignment, if any */
00362 
00363              data = NextValue (data);
00364 
00365              /* Add any formatting that might be necessary to separate
00366                 values */
00367 
00368             if (data != NULL)
00369               {
00370                 switch (parameter->value_kind)
00371                   {
00372                     case KV_SEQUENCE:
00373                       col_count++;
00374                       if (col_count >= parameter->columns)
00375                         {
00376                           stmt[len++] = ')';
00377                           stmt[len++] = '\n';
00378                           indentf (vindent-1);
00379                           stmt[len++] = '(';
00380                           ncol = vindent;
00381                           col_count = 0;
00382                         }
00383                       else
00384                         {
00385                           stmt[len++] = ',';
00386                           stmt[len++] = ' ';
00387                           ncol += 2;
00388                         }
00389                       break;
00390 
00391                     default:
00392                       stmt[len++] = ',';
00393                       stmt[len++] = ' ';
00394                       ncol += 2;
00395                       break;
00396                   }
00397                }   
00398             }
00399 
00400           /* We've processed all the values for this assignment.  Put
00401              out any necessary end-of-assignment formatting */
00402 
00403           switch (parameter->value_kind)
00404             {
00405               case KV_SEQUENCE:
00406                for (i=0; (i < ip); i++)
00407                   {
00408                     stmt[len++] = ')';
00409                   }
00410                break;
00411 
00412               case KV_SET:
00413                stmt[len++] = '}';
00414                break;
00415 
00416               default:
00417                break;
00418             }
00419 
00420           stmt[len++] = '\n';
00421           stmt[len] = '\0';
00422           ODLPrintStmt (stmt);
00423           
00424           /* Get the next parameter for this object, if any */
00425 
00426           parameter = NextParameter (parameter);
00427         }
00428 
00429       /* Get the next object or group node, if any */
00430 
00431       old_node = node;
00432       node = NextSubAggregate (base_node, node);
00433     }
00434 
00435   /* Print out any END_OBJECTs or END_GROUPs that we have pending */
00436 
00437   while (old_node != base_node)
00438     {
00439       len = 0;
00440       nindent -= INDENTSIZE;
00441       indentf (nindent);
00442       sprintf (&stmt[len], "%-*s = %s\n\n",
00443                no,
00444                (old_node->kind == KA_OBJECT) ? "END_OBJECT" : "END_GROUP",
00445                old_node->name);
00446       ODLPrintStmt (stmt);
00447       old_node = ParentAggregate (old_node);
00448     }
00449 
00450   /* Print out the terminating END statement */
00451 
00452 #ifdef PDS_TOOLBOX
00453   if (pds_finish_label)
00454      ODLPrintStmt ("END\n");
00455 #else
00456   ODLPrintStmt ("END\n");
00457 #endif
00458 
00459   return;
00460 }
